Job Location:&nbsp;Iyana Ipaja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Hours: 10am - 7 pm WAT

Key Responsibilities
ITB, RFP, and Proposal Response Preparation:


	Review bid documents, drawings, addendums, specifications, and scope narratives from general contractors.
	Generate complete HVAC technical response packages, including system descriptions, compliance matrices, and design concepts.
	Prepare preliminary HVAC layouts, equipment selections, and system schematics.
	Develop technical narratives supporting design intent, value engineering options, and constructability recommendations.
	Identify scope gaps, exclusions, clarifications, and risk factors requiring internal review.
	Support the estimating team with system design assumptions and competitive pricing strategies.


HVAC Engineering &amp; System Design:


	Perform HVAC load calculations, equipment sizing, and ventilation calculations.
	Select appropriate HVAC systems (RTUs, VRF/VRV, chilled water, hot water, packaged units, exhaust, controls).
	Review and interpret mechanical codes including IMC, ASHRAE, and energy codes.
	Translate conceptual drawings into preliminary engineering documents.
	Coordinate with manufacturers to verify equipment performance and budget pricing.


Costing, Estimating, and Bill of Materials:


	Prepare bills of materials for ductwork, piping, equipment, and controls.
	Provide labor and material quantities using digital takeoff tools.
	Collaborate with estimators to validate cost assumptions.
	Review vendor quotes and subcontractor pricing.


Coordination and Stakeholder Engagement:


	Collaborate with project managers, estimators, engineers, and field teams.
	Attend pre-bid meetings, job walks, and technical calls.
	Coordinate with GCs, architects, and MEP consultants to resolve inconsistencies.


Quality Control &amp; Documentation:


	Ensure proposals meet HVAC code requirements and project specifications.
	Prepare compliance documentation, schedules, engineering assumptions, and drawings.
	Maintain accurate bid files for audit and future use.


Requirements
Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in HVAC system design, load calculations, and equipment sizing.
	Ability to interpret mechanical drawings and specifications.
	Proficiency with HVAC tools such as Carrier HAP, Trane Trace, AutoCAD, Revit, and Bluebeam.
	Strong knowledge of IMC, ASHRAE, and energy codes.


Preferred Qualifications


	Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field.
	2 years in Mechanical/HVAC construction or HVAC engineering.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunity to work on exciting projects in a collaborative environment.
	Professional growth and development opportunities.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Corporate Transactional Support Officer Job at First Bank of Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        First Bank of Nigeria Limited (FirstBank) is Nigeria's largest financial services institution by total assets and gross earnings. With more than 10 million customer accounts, FirstBank has over 750 branches providing a comprehensive range of retail and corporate financial services. The Bank has international presence through its subsidiaries, FBN Bank (UK) Limited in London and Paris, FBNBank DRC, FBNBank Ghana, FBNBank Gambia, FBNBank Guinea, FBNBank Sierra-Leone and FBNBank Senegal, as well as its Representative Offices in Johannesburg, Beijing and Abu Dhabi.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Corporate Transactional Support Officer - SBUS
     

            
    



Job Identification: 1652
Job Location: Lagos
Job Schedule: Full time

Responsibilities


	Provides, under the guidance of the Team Lead, legal advisory services in respect of various contracts to SBUs, SRFs and the Bank’s subsidiaries with respect to structured finance, project finance, international trade, oil & gas financing, derivatives, telecommunications financing (operators, service providers and dealers) highlighting the Bank’s attendant obligations, privileges and rights and consequences of breach of such contracts
	Researches and prepares legal opinions on basic day-to-day issues bothering on the Unit’s activities. 
	Attending meetings with SBUs and other SRFs for purposes of negotiating terms and conditions of commercial transaction to be entered into by the Bank.
	Prepares the drafts of all species of local and cross-border Bonds and Guarantees and vets/reviews drafts of same prepared by counterparties to ensure there are no adverse clauses and that the interest of the Bank is adequately protected and understudies the Team Lead and Guarantee Supervisors in the Department in the art of Bonds and Guarantee drafting and reviews.
	Supports the Team Lead in the actualization of numerous product and service offerings, alliances, partnerships and other synergistic relationships created by the Products & Channels Unit.
	Prepares, reviews and vets a wide range of documentation, including but not limited to letter of domiciliation, Indemnities, Irrevocable Remittance Undertakings, Irrevocable Standard Payment Orders, Letters of Comfort, Letters of Support, Letters of Intent, etc.
	Prepare Loan Agreements, Corporate Guarantees, Sales & Collection Agreements, Letters of Hypothecation, Equipment Leases, Deeds of Release etc.
	Conducts, analyzes, and interprets searches on Certificates of Registration/Incorporation of corporate entities.
	Supports the Team Lead and Unit Head in the provision of general advisory services to the Bank’s subsidiaries.
	Ensures compliance with the principles and policies contained in the Information Security Handbook.
	Ensures compliance with the principles and policies contained in the Business Continuity Management Handbook.
	Assists the Team Lead and Unit Head in the Unit’s involvement in, and compliance with the Bank’s Information Security Management Policies, Business Continuity Management, BS25999, ISO 27001, and initiatives, internal audit outcomes and compliance with recommendations, ICAFAS, Business Performance Management, PSQA etc.


Requirements


	Minimum of a First Degree or its equivalent in a IT related discipline
	5+ years of experience in systems support/ administration.
	Masters or a recognized professional certification will be an added advantage

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Logistics Project Manager",
  "description": "Siemens is an Integrated Technology Company. The business activities of our Energy, Health care, Industry and Infrastructure &amp; Cities Sectors have enabled us to capture leading market and technology positions worldwide. Technological excellence, innovation, quality, reliability and international focus have been our hallmarks for 165 years, making us strong and linking us to our shareholders, employees and customers as a partner of trust.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Project Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time
Organization:&nbsp;Grid Technologies
Business Unit: Grid Solutions
Department: SE GT GS EU&amp;AF WE&amp;AF, Nigeria
Mode of Employment: Contract Employment

Job Description
A Snapshot of Your Day:


	As a Logistics Project Manager at Siemens Energy, you will play a key role in enabling the successful delivery of complex projects by ensuring seamless, compliant, and cost-effective onshore logistics operations across Nigeria.
	You will be responsible for planning, coordinating, and controlling all onshore logistics activities, with a strong focus on logistics documentation, warehousing, inland transportation, and shipment optimization.
	While customs clearance activities are executed by a dedicated Customs Professional, you will work closely with them to ensure all project-specific logistics and documentation requirements are met in line with Nigerian regulations and Siemens Energy standards.
	Your work will directly support project execution schedules, reduce logistics-related risks, and contribute to Siemens Energy&rsquo;s commitment to reliable, sustainable, and efficient project delivery.


Responsibilities
Onshore Logistics Planning &amp; Execution:


	Plan and coordinate all onshore logistics activities including port interface, warehousing, and inland transportation
	Develop and implement project-specific logistics concepts aligned with schedules, construction sequences, and budget requirements.
	Coordinate with Project Management, Procurement, Engineering, and Site Teams to ensure timely material availability.
	Establish logistics schedules, milestones, and KPIs and monitor execution progress.


Documentation &amp; Trade Compliance Coordination:


	Coordinate logistics documentation requirements in line with project and regulatory needs.
	Ensure consistency between shipping documents, project requirements, and regulatory processes.
	Support resolution of documentation-related issues impacting delivery timelines.


Inland Transportation Management:


	Manage warehousing activities including receipt, storage, inventory control, preservation, and dispatch.
	Coordinate inland transportation including route assessments, permits, escorts, and site delivery sequencing.
	Oversee handling of heavy-lift, oversized, and sensitive cargo.
	Ensure safe and timely delivery to multiple project locations.


Shipment Optimization &amp; Cost Efficiency:


	Develop shipment optimization strategies (Containerization, consolidation, multimodal solutions) to reduce cost and transit time
	Evaluate logistics options and propose alternative routes or methods to mitigate risks and delays
	Monitor logistics budgets and identify efficiency improvements without compromising safety or compliance.


Stakeholder and Vendor Management:


	Coordinate logistics service providers, transporters, warehouse operators, and freight forwarders.
	Act as the main onshore logistics interface between Siemens Energy and external partners
	Lead coordination meetings and reporting.


Risk Management &amp; Problem Solving:


	Identify logistics-related risks and define mitigation measures
	Implement contingency plans in coordination with project teams
	Resolve logistics execution issues proactively.


Health, Safety &amp; Quality:


	Ensure compliance with Siemens Energy EHS policies and local regulations
	Promote a strong safety culture across logistics activities
	Ensure logistics execution meets Siemens Energy quality standards.


What You Bring&nbsp;


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Engineering, Business Administration, or related field.
	Minimum of 10 years of experience in project logistics with strong onshore logistics exposure in Nigeria.
	Proven experience coordinating Form M and IDEC documentation processes.
	Strong background in warehousing and inland transportation for large or complex projects.
	Demonstrated expertise in shipment optimization strategies.
	Experience in EPC, energy, or infrastructure projects is an advantage.
	Strong communication, coordination, and stakeholder management skills.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities in multidisciplinary teams.
	Proficiency in MS Office and Project management tools
	Mediation skills in case of conflicts
	Goal-oriented, comfortable working in diverse teams, and experienced in managing multiple tasks simultaneously.


Rewards


	Working with a global team
	Opportunities to work on and lead a variety of innovative projects
	Possibility to take over further tasks within the company
	Supportive work culture
	Medical benefits
	Remote/Flexible work
	Time off/Paid holidays
	Parental leave
	Continual learning through the Learn@Siemens-Energy platform
	e-Learning
	Mentorship
	Coaching

	Strong background in warehousing and inland transportation for large or complex projects.
	Demonstrated expertise in shipment optimization strategies.
	Experience in EPC, energy, or infrastructure projects is an advantage.
	Strong communication, coordination, and stakeholder management skills.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities in multidisciplinary teams.
	Proficiency in MS Office and Project management tools
	Mediation skills in case of conflicts
	Goal-oriented, comfortable working in diverse teams, and experienced in managing multiple tasks simultaneously.


Rewards

	Opportunities to work on and lead a variety of innovative projects
	Possibility to take over further tasks within the company
	Supportive work culture
	Medical benefits
	Remote/Flexible work
	Time off/Paid holidays
